summary: Michelle Combs is identified as the sender of fax transmissions containing briefing questions for the Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB). These questions, directed to Barry Harrelson of the ARRB, pertain to CIA's Directorate of Science and Technology (DS&T) and Directorate of Operations (DO). The questions cover a range of topics related to the JFK assassination, including records related to the HTLINGUAL project, Castro assassination plots, destroyed records, Mexico City station activities, operational funding, relationships with journalists, the QKENCHANT project, and Clay Shaw. The documents suggest that Michelle Combs played a role in preparing questions and gathering information for the ARRB's investigation into the JFK assassination records held by the CIA.
significance: Michelle Combs' significance lies in her role in facilitating the ARRB's inquiry into CIA records related to the JFK assassination. As the sender of briefing questions, she appears to have been involved in identifying key areas of interest and gathering information to aid the ARRB's investigation.
